main event: On January 18, 1949 at 18/0022 Z, a fast-moving bright light was observed over Indian House Lake, Canada. It was thought to be a shooting star or a meteor.
interesting points: The object was only visible as a bright light, with the actual object not being sighted.
The personnel at Indian House believed the object or light was not sighted again.
The speed of the object was described as exceedingly fast.
The observation was classified as a ground visual type.
Despite the initial uncertainty, the military concluded that the sighting was most likely due to an astro (meteor).
